title: CCTV released after girl, 14, raped in broad daylight in park
text:

A 14-year-old girl was raped in a park in broad daylight in Birmingham, according to police.

West Midlands Police say the girl was attacked on October 4 in Kingfisher Country Park, near Hall Green.

The force have released footage of the man they want to speak to in connection with the sex attack, reports Birmingham Live.

The footage shows a man in a red coat, jeans and boots stood at the roadside near to the popular park.

A West Midlands Police statement said: "Do you recognise this man? He is wanted by police after a 14-year-old girl was raped in Kingfisher Country Park, Birmingham at around 12pm on Friday 4 October."

Police are also appealing to another man who they believe might have some vital information that could lead them to the rapist. The man can be seen getting off a bus as the girl got on here:

The statement added: "We also want to speak to the man who got off the bus as the girl got on, as we believe he may be a crucial witness."

(Image: BPM Media)

Kingfisher Country Park runs along an 11 kilometre stretch of the River Cole valley and features a number of man-made lakes. It's a popular spot for families due to its open spaces and woodland.

Anyone who recognises the man is asked to call police on 101 or Crimestoppers in confidence on 0800 555 111.
description: West Midlands Police want to speak to the man in the footage in connection with the rape of a teenage girl earlier this month in a Birmingham park
